Bink SDK 1.7b

BinkSoundUseSDLMixer

The function BinkSoundUseSDLMixer tells Bink to use SDL_mixer as its sound output system under GNU/Linux.

S32 BinkSoundUseSDLMixer();

Returns

Returns whether Bink successfully switched to SDL_mixer as its output layer (non-zero for success, zero for failure).

Discussion

This function (macro actually) tells Bink to use SDL for its audio output under GNU/Linux.

This function is global - you only need to call it once. You must, however, call it before you ever call BinkOpen and after you have called the SDL function Mix_OpenAudio, or the function will fail (or crash if you haven't called Mix_OpenAudio).
